html.p: Customers in security sensitive environments can now run the Splunk Universal forwarder on Windows platforms as a domain user without having to grant that domain user local administrator privileges on the box. When configured to run in this low privilege mode, the Universal forwarder will continue to be able to run all the Windows inputs native to Splunk for data ingest in a secure manner.
Below are the relevant screenshots in the UF install workflow which control the credentials that the UF is installed with –

p.i: 1. As shown in the screenshot below, select “Domain Account” and click Next.

2. Enter the domain user and password. Make sure that the checkbox for “Add user as local administrator” is unchecked. By default, this checkbox is checked and needs to be unchecked by the user to install the UF with lowered privileges.
3. Continue through the rest of the install workflow and on completion, the UF is installed as the domain user specified (without local administrator rights).
